paragraph.leadIn: if, as may be applicable in the particular case, having regard to all the circumstances, including the number of occasions and the gravity in respect of which, after the issue of the licence—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a licence condition;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a requirement under this Ordinance which is applicable to it;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a direction, order, or determination, under this Ordinance which is applicable to it; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: a provision of a Code of Practice which is applicable to it;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: another person has contravened a condition, requirement, direction, order, determination or provision mentioned in subparagraph (i) and such contravention has taken place with the consent or connivance of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall, before making a decision whether or not to suspend a licence under subsection (1)— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: serve on the licensee a notice in writing stating that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Authority has under consideration the suspension of the licence and the grounds upon which and any other reason why such suspension is being considered;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: representations as regards the proposed suspension may be made to the Authority during the period specified in the notice (being a period of not less than 28 days beginning on the date of service of the notice); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider any representations made to it in relation to the proposed suspension; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a domestic free television programme service or a domestic pay television programme service where subsection (2)(b) is applicable, conduct a public hearing in accordance with procedures for the hearing determined by the Authority. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: The suspension of a licence under subsection (1) shall not come into force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), until the expiration of the period during which an appeal under section 34 against the suspension may be made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal under section 34 against the suspension is made, until the appeal is withdrawn, abandoned or determined.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Revocation of licence

subsection.content: Where the Authority considers that there may be cause for the Chief Executive in Council or it, as the case may require, to revoke a licence under subsection (4), it shall conduct an inquiry in accordance with section 33 and, if the licence was granted by the Chief Executive in Council, submit recommendations to the Chief Executive in Council concerning the revocation. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

The Authority may as part of its inquiry, and shall where its inquiry concerns the provisions of subsection (4)(c), conduct a public hearing in accordance with procedures for the hearing determined by the Authority. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of procedures which the Authority may determine under subsection (2), it— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may, notwithstanding section 27, divulge any data, book, document or record it has received in the course of the public hearing to any person it considers appropriate on terms of confidentiality or otherwise or treat the same as confidential; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall publish in such manner as it considers fit a report of the public hearing and, if the licence was granted by the Chief Executive in Council, together with its recommendations to the Chief Executive in Council.

subsection.leadIn: After section 33 has been complied with but subject to subsection (5), the Chief Executive in Council or the Authority, as the case may require, may, by notice in writing served on the licensee, revoke a licence— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for failure by the licensee to pay—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any licence fee, or any other fee or charge owing by the licensee under this Ordinance, within 60 days beginning on the date the payment is due; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: any financial penalty within 60 days beginning on the date the payment is due—

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: under section 29(4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the licensee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: goes into compulsory liquidation or into voluntary liquidation other than for the purposes of amalgamation or reconstruction; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: enters into a composition or arrangement with its creditors; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if, as may be applicable in the particular case, having regard to all the circumstances, including the number of occasions and the gravity in respect of which, after the issue of the licence—

subparagraph.name: i
A
subparagraph.content: a licence condition;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a requirement under this Ordinance which is applicable to it;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a direction, order, or determination, under this Ordinance which is applicable to it; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: a provision in a Code of Practice which is applicable to it,

subparagraph.continued: and the licensee has failed to comply with a direction under section 24(1) relating to that contravention;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: another person has contravened a condition, requirement, direction, order, determination or provision mentioned in subparagraph (i) and such contravention has taken place with the consent or connivance of the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council or the Authority shall not exercise a power under subsection (4) until after considering— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the Chief Executive in Council, the recommendations of the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of both the Chief Executive in Council and the Authority, such information, matter and advice as he or it thinks fit.

subsection.content: The revocation by the Chief Executive in Council under subsection (4) of a licence shall take effect on the date the notice of the revocation is served on the licensee or on such later date as is specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The revocation by the Authority under subsection (4) of a licence shall not take effect— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), until the expiration of the period during which an appeal under section 34 against the revocation may be made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal under section 34 against the revocation is made, until the appeal is withdrawn, abandoned or determined.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Inquiry by Authority

subsection.content: Where the Authority conducts an inquiry under section 32(1), it may consider information and matter received from any source.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions shall apply in relation to an inquiry under section 32(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority shall serve on the licensee a notice in writing stating— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the revocation of its licence is under consideration;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the grounds upon which and any other reason why the revocation of its licence is being considered; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that representations as regards the proposed revocation may be made to the Authority during such period as shall be specified in the notice (being a period of not less than 28 days beginning on the date of service of the notice);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority shall consider any representations made to it as regards the proposed revocation.

subsection.content: The Authority shall consider any representations submitted by the licensee and such further information and matter as it may consider necessary by reason of such representations.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Appeal to Chief Executive in Council

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of this section, a licensee (including a person seeking to be a licensee) aggrieved by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a decision of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Authority in the exercise of a discretion conferred on it under this Ordinance or the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391) (including a decision to specify a condition in a licence); (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: anything contained in a direction, order, or determination, under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: anything contained in a Code of Practice,

subsection.continued: may appeal by way of petition to the Chief Executive in Council, not later than 30 days beginning on the date of the relevant decision, the issue or making of the direction, order, or determination, or the publication of the Code of Practice, as the case may be.

subsection.content: Subject to sections 31(4) and 32(7), pending the determination of an appeal under subsection (1), the licensee shall comply with the matter mentioned in that subsection being appealed against.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Determination of appeal

subsection.leadIn: In determining an appeal under section 34, the Chief Executive in Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may receive information and advice from the Authority or any other person he considers appropriate; and (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall afford the licensee concerned a reasonable opportunity to make representations on such information and advice, if any, received.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may determine an appeal by confirming, varying or reversing the decision, direction, order, or determination, appealed against or, where appropriate, by directing that the relevant provision of the Code of Practice be amended as specified by him.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Court may prohibit certain television programmes, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A licensee shall not include in its licensed service a television programme, or any part thereof, that is likely, in Hong Kong, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: incite hatred against any group of persons, being a group defined by reference to colour, race, sex, religion, nationality or ethnic or national origins;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: result in a general breakdown in law and order; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: gravely damage public health or morals.

subsection.content: Where the Chief Secretary reasonably believes that the inclusion of a television programme, or any part thereof, in a licensed service would contravene subsection (1), the Chief Secretary may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order under this section.

In a case of urgency, the Chief Secretary may, under subsection (2), make an application for an interim order, ex parte and on affidavit, but otherwise the application shall be made by motion or summons.

Where the Chief Secretary makes an application under subsection (2), the Court of First Instance may, where it is satisfied that the inclusion of a television programme, or any part thereof, in a licensed service would contravene subsection (1), make an order prohibiting the inclusion of the whole or any part of the programme in the licensed service and requiring any person who in the opinion of the Court would be knowingly involved in that contravention to take such steps as the Court may direct for the purpose of giving effect to the prohibition.

Where the Chief Secretary makes an application under subsection (2), the Court of First Instance may, by order, require the licensee or any other person referred to in subsection (4) to produce to it any material in the possession or control of the licensee or other person and which relates to the television programme the subject of the application.

Where subsection (3) applies to an application under subsection (2), the Court of First Instance shall not make an interim order under subsection (4) or (5) unless it is satisfied that it is a case of urgency.
Any material produced under subsection (5) shall not be admissible in any criminal proceedings against the licensee, or person, producing it.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (9), rules of court may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the discharge and variation of orders under this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceedings relating to such orders; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: costs.

subsection.content: The power to make rules of court under section 54 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) shall include the power to make rules of court for the purposes of this section.
The jurisdiction of the Court of First Instance under this section shall not be exercised by the Registrar of the High Court or a Master of that Court.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Contests
section.content: Notwithstanding the provisions of the Gambling Ordinance (Cap. 148), contests which comply with the standards set out in a Code of Practice applicable to contests may be organized in connection with television programmes included in a licensed service and may form part of those programmes.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Inspection and testing of technical equipment

subsection.content: The Authority or any person authorized in writing by it in that behalf may, at any reasonable time, inspect and test any equipment or part thereof used, or intended to be used, by a licensee for the provision of any television programme service for the purpose of ascertaining whether or not the licensee is complying with such technical standards as the Authority considers necessary in order for the licensee to comply with any requirement under a prescribed Ordinance, any licence condition or any provision in a Code of Practice applicable to it.

subsection.leadIn: The directors, principal officers and other employees of a licensee shall, for the purpose of any inspection or test under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make available on request to the Authority or any person authorized by it for the purpose of the inspection or test and permit to be inspected and tested any equipment or part thereof used, or intended to be used, for the provision of any television programme service;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if so required by the Authority or such authorized person, give any explanation or particulars which the Authority or person considers necessary for the purposes of exercising any powers of the Authority or such person under this section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: assist the Authority or such authorized person in carrying out the inspection or test in any manner specified by the Authority or such person.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (2) shall oblige any person to answer any question which incriminates or might incriminate him or which relates to matters not within his knowledge or to give information which cannot reasonably be expected to be in his possession or under his control.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Licensee to submit returns

subsection.content: A licensee shall submit to the Authority on or before 1 April of each year a return in the specified form showing the names and places of residence of the directors and principal officers of the licensee and indicating whether or not those directors and principal officers are for the time being ordinarily resident in Hong Kong and have been so resident for at least one continuous period of not less than 7 years. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2019)

A domestic free television programme service licensee or domestic pay television programme service licensee shall submit, at the same time as the return submitted under subsection (1), a statutory declaration made by the company secretary of, or a director of, the licensee showing whether or not any disqualified person has exercised any control in the licensee during the year immediately preceding the year to which the return relates.

Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (1), where there is any change of directors or principal officers in a licensee, the licensee shall submit to the Authority a return in the specified form showing particulars of the change, within 7 days beginning on the date the change takes place.

A licensee shall submit to the Authority, within a reasonable time after being required to do so, such other information as the Authority considers necessary for the purpose of performing its functions under this Ordinance.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Service of documents

subsection.content: A document (howsoever described) required to be served under this Ordinance may be served by prepaying (where requisite), registering and posting an envelope addressed to the person on or to whom the document is to be served at his usual or last known place of abode or business and containing the document; and, unless there is evidence to the contrary, the document shall be deemed to have been served and received at the time at which such envelope would have been delivered in the ordinary course of post.

For the purposes of this section, a company shall be deemed to have its usual place of business at its registered office, and any other body corporate shall be deemed to have a usual place of business at its principal office or any other place at which it carries on business.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Power of Authority to specify forms

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Authority may specify the form of any document (howsoever described) required under this Ordinance to be in the specified form and the form of such other documents (howsoever described) required for the purposes of this Ordinance as it thinks fit.

The Authority’s power under subsection (1) shall be subject to any express requirement under this Ordinance for a form, whether specified or otherwise, to comply with that requirement, but that requirement shall not restrict the exercise of that power in respect of that form to the extent that, in the opinion of the Authority, its exercise of that power in respect of that form does not contravene that requirement.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority’s power under subsection (1) may be exercised in such a way as to— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include in the specified form of any document referred to in that subsection a statutory declaration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be made by the person completing the form; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to whether the particulars contained in the form are true and correct to the best of that person’s knowledge and belief;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify 2 or more forms of any document referred to in that subsection, whether as alternatives, or to provide for particular circumstances or particular cases, as the Authority thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under this section shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with such directions and instructions as are specified in the form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by such documents as are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the completed form is required to be provided to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Authority;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: another person on behalf of the Authority; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other person,

paragraph.continued: so provided in the manner, if any, specified in the form.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a licence, specify requirements, additional to those specified elsewhere in this Ordinance, with respect to the control, whether direct or indirect, to be exercised over the provision of television programme services, the board of directors, or property used or kept by the licensee in connection with its licensed service by any other person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: empower the Authority to waive or dispense with the requirements mentioned in paragraph (a) generally or in a particular case on the grounds specified in the regulation; (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a domestic free television programme service licence or domestic pay television programme service licence, specify requirements, additional to those specified elsewhere in this Ordinance, with respect to the beneficial ownership or control, whether direct or indirect, of any of the voting shares in the licensee;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of securing compliance with Parts 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 by a domestic free television programme service licensee, make provision for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: matters relating to voting controllers under that Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the holding, acquisition or disposal of rights, titles and interests to or in voting shares in a licensee;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: specify television programme and advertising standards, including, without limitation, restrictions on the time of day when television programme and advertisements may be provided, and may do so for different licensees and different broadcasting services;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: prescribe anything that may be prescribed under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: provide for any matter incidental or ancillary to or necessary to give effect to any matter referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f).

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), regulations under subsection (1) shall be subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.
Subject to subsection (4), subsection (2) shall not apply to regulations under subsection (1)(f) or regulations under subsection (1)(g) to the extent that they relate to subsection (1)(f).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), any regulation under this section may provide that a contravention of a specified provision of any regulation under any provision of this section shall be an offence punishable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.content: Regulations under subsection (1)(d) may provide that a contravention of a specified provision made thereunder shall be an offence punishable with a fine not exceeding $1,000,000 and a term of imprisonment not exceeding 2 years.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules 1 to 8, etc.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice in the Gazette, amend any of Schedules 1 to 8 and amendments to Schedule 1 or 3 shall be subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

Any provision in Schedule 4, 5, 6 or 7 relating to any matter as regards an applicant for a licence, licensee or a licensed service shall be in addition to and not in substitution of any other provision in this Ordinance relating to that matter.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Repeal, transitional and savings provisions and consequential amendments

subsection.content: The Television Ordinance (Cap. 52) is repealed.
Schedule 8 sets out the transitional and savings provisions applicable upon subsection (1) coming into operation*.
The enactments specified in Schedule 9 are amended as set out in that Schedule.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Transitional and savings provisions—Broadcasting and Telecommunications Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020
section.content: Schedule 10 sets out the transitional and savings provisions relating to the Broadcasting and Telecommunications Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020 (23 of 2020).

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Disqualification for Holding Domestic Free or Pay Television Programme Service Licences and Restriction on Voting Control of Voting Controllers

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Associate
def.leadIn: associate (相聯者), in relation to a voting controller holding voting control (whether the controller is qualified or unqualified), means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the voting controller holding the voting control is an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a relative of the voting controller;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a partner of the voting controller or a relative of the partner;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a partnership in which the voting controller is a partner;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the voting controller;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a partner of the voting controller; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a partnership in which the voting controller is a partner; or

subparagraph.name: v

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the voting controller holding the voting control is a corporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an associated corporation;

subparagraph.name: A

subparagraph.name: B
iii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the voting controller holding the voting control is a partnership—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a member of the partnership and, if the partner is an individual, a relative of the member;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: a partner of the partnership and, where the partner—

subparagraph.name: A

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.name: v

def.name: AssociatedCorporation
def.leadIn: associated corporation (相聯法團), in relation to a voting controller holding voting control (whether qualified or unqualified), means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation over which the voting controller has influence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a corporation which has influence over the voting controller being itself a corporation (the second corporation);

paragraph.name: c

subsection.def: disqualified person (不符合持牌資格人士) means a person who is a disqualified person under section 4 or 5; (Amended 23 of 2020 s. 5)

def.name: Influence
def.leadIn: influence (影響、影響力), in relation to a corporation, means the power of a voting controller to ensure—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: by virtue of any powers conferred by the memorandum or articles of association regulating that or any other corporation,

subsection.def: licensee (持牌人) means the holder of a licence;
licensee’s register (持牌人登記冊), in relation to a particular licensee, means the register required to be kept under section 627 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: PrincipalOfficer
def.leadIn: principal officer (主要人員), in relation to a corporation, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person employed or engaged by the corporation who, by himself or with 1 or more other persons, is responsible under the immediate authority of the directors of the corporation for the conduct of the business of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person so employed or engaged who, under the immediate authority of a director of the corporation or a person to whom paragraph (a) applies, performs managerial functions in respect of the corporation;

def.name: QualifiedVotingController
def.leadIn: qualified voting controller (一般表決控權人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a voting controller who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an individual, is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong and has been so resident for at least one continuous period of not less than 7 years; (Amended 17 of 2018 s. 136)

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a voting controller who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the trustee or manager of any unit trust or mutual fund authorized as a collective investment scheme under section 104 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Amended 5 of 2002 s. 407)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the trustee of a charitable scheme made by order of a court of competent jurisdiction;

subparagraph.name: iii
iv
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of the High Court; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: such other person as may be prescribed;

def.name: Relative
def.leadIn: relative (親屬), in relation to an individual, means a spouse, parent, child, brother or sister of the individual, and for the purposes of this definition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an adopted child is regarded as a child both of the natural parents and the adoptive parents; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a stepchild is regarded as a child both of the natural parents and any step-parents; (Replaced 23 of 2020 s. 5)

subsection.def: total voting control (總計表決控制權) means the aggregate of voting control;

def.name: VotingControl
def.leadIn: voting control (表決控制權) means the control of or the ability to control, whether directly or indirectly, the exercise of the right to vote attaching to 1 or more voting shares of a licensee—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: by an entitlement to exercise such a right to vote;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: under a duty or obligation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: through a nominee;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: through or by means of a trust, agreement or arrangement, understanding or practice, whether or not the trust, agreement or arrangement, understanding or practice has legal or equitable force or is based on legal or equitable rights; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: as a chargor of voting shares of a licensee unless the chargee of the voting shares or the nominee of the chargee has given notice in writing to the chargor under the charge of an intention to exercise the right to vote attaching to such voting shares;

subsection.def: voting controller (表決控權人) means a person who either alone or with 1 or more other persons holds voting control.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 or more voting controllers together are voting controllers in relation to the same voting share; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 or more of them is a disqualified person,

subsection.continued: then, for the purposes of this Schedule, each of the voting controllers referred to in paragraph (a) shall, in relation to the voting share mentioned in that paragraph, be regarded as a disqualified person.

subsection.content: When 2 or more voting controllers together are voting controllers in relation to the same voting share and 1 or more than 1 of those voting controllers is an unqualified voting controller, then for the purposes of this Schedule, each of those voting controllers shall, in relation to that voting share, be regarded as an unqualified voting controller.
For the purposes of this Schedule, the fact that the particular voting share or shares in relation to which a person is a voting controller cannot be identified is immaterial.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, any reference to exercise of control—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a corporation, shall be construed in accordance with subsection (6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a body other than a corporation, means the power of a person to ensure, by virtue of the rules regulating that or any other body, that the affairs of the first-mentioned body are conducted in accordance with the wishes of that person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5)(a), a person exercises control of a corporation if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is a director or principal officer of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is the beneficial owner of more than 15% of the voting shares in the corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he is a voting controller of more than 15% of the voting shares in the corporation; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: he otherwise has the power, by virtue of any powers conferred by the memorandum or articles of association or other instrument regulating that corporation or any other corporation, to ensure that the affairs of the first-mentioned corporation are conducted in accordance with the wishes of that person,

subsection.continued: and any reference in this Schedule to exercising control of a licensee shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Any reference in this Schedule to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holding or being beneficially entitled to shares in a corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being a voting controller of any voting shares in a corporation,

subsection.continued: shall be construed as a reference to his being so entitled, whether by himself or jointly with other persons, and whether directly or through 1 or more nominees.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, 2 corporations are members of the same group if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1 of them is a corporation of which the other is a subsidiary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: both are subsidiaries of another corporation.

subsection.def: In subsection (8), subsidiary (附屬公司), in relation to a corporation, has the same meaning which a subsidiary has in relation to another body corporate under section 15 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application
section.content: Part 3 shall not apply to a domestic pay television programme service, domestic pay television programme service licence or domestic pay television programme service licensee.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Disqualification for Holding Domestic Free or Pay Television Programme Service Licences and Restrictions on Voting Control

section.name: s3
section.heading: Disqualified person not to hold licence or exercise control

subsection.content: A disqualified person shall not become the holder of a licence or exercise control of a licensee unless the disqualification was disclosed in the application for the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Chief Executive in Council, on application in the specified form by a licensee, is satisfied that the public interest so requires and approves otherwise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person shall not become or remain the holder of a licence if he is a disqualified person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person shall not exercise control of a licensee if he is a disqualified person.

subsection.leadIn: In considering the public interest for the purposes of subsection (2), account shall be taken of, but not limited to, the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the effect on competition in the relevant service market;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extent to which viewers will be offered more diversified television programme choices;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the impact on the development of the broadcasting industry; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the overall benefits to the economy.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Disqualification of licensees

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), any one of the following shall be a disqualified person in relation to a licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensee in the same category of licence;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a person who exercises control in the licensee mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an associate of a person who is a disqualified person by virtue of paragraph (a), (b) or (c).

subsection.content: A licensee mentioned in subsection (1)(a) or (b) shall not be disqualified from holding a licence by reason only of the fact that it has, under Part 4, obtained the prior approval in writing of the Chief Executive in Council to hold or acquire an interest in a company which is a disqualified person.

A person shall not be a disqualified person in relation to a company which is a licensee by reason only of the fact that he is a director or a principal officer of, or holds or controls more than 15% of the voting shares in, that company.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Disqualification of sound broadcasting licensees
section.leadIn: The following are disqualified persons in relation to a licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sound broadcasting licensee under Part 3A of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106); (Amended E.R. 2 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who exercises control over a licensee mentioned in paragraph (a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an associate of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a licensee mentioned in paragraph (a); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person mentioned in paragraph (b).

section.name: s8
section.heading: Restriction on disqualified persons acting in association with voting controllers

subsection.leadIn: Where a voting controller holds or acquires voting control of the voting shares of a licensee as an associate of a disqualified person and it appears to the Authority that a purpose of the holding or acquisition is to avoid a restriction imposed on a disqualified person under this Part, then the Authority may, by notice in writing served on any voting controller whom it believes to be a party to the holding or acquisition, give directions to the voting controller which appear to the Authority to be necessary to— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: effect a cesser of the holding or acquisition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure compliance with the restriction.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the directions are given for the purpose of subsection (1)(a), those directions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the directions are given for the purpose of subsection (1)(b), those directions and the restriction required to be complied with; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the period within which the directions are required to be complied with.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall be construed as restricting or otherwise affecting a person’s power to transfer a voting share.

Where 2 or more persons act together to hold or acquire the voting control of the voting shares of a licensee, then, for the purposes of this Part, each of those persons shall be regarded in relation to the voting shares of the licensee as being an associate of the other and of any other person acting on the directions of any of them to hold or to acquire voting control over those voting shares.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Licensee’s power to investigate a disqualified person

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensee knows or has reasonable cause to believe a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a voting controller of voting shares of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to have been such a controller at any time during the relevant period; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to have assisted in or been a party to any transaction involving, in respect of any such voting share, a change of voting controller,

subsection.continued: then the licensee may, by notice in writing served on the person, require the person—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to confirm or refute that fact; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: if he confirms it, to give such further particulars as may be required under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) may require the person on whom it is served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to give particulars as to his status as a disqualified person or otherwise at any time during the relevant period;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: where he has at any time during the relevant period been a voting controller, but at the time the notice is given has ceased to be so, to give particulars which are within his knowledge or belief relating to the address and identity of any person who became a voting controller immediately upon his ceasing to be a voting controller; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where he has at any time during the relevant period assisted in or been a party to any transaction involving, in respect of any voting share, a change of voting controller, to give particulars which are within his knowledge or belief relating to the address and identity of any person who became a voting controller upon the change.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) shall specify a period within which the requirements of the notice are to be complied with.

Where any particulars are given to a licensee under this section, it shall, not later than 15 days beginning on the date it receives the particulars, give the Authority notice in writing of the particulars. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.def: In this section, relevant period (有關期間), in relation to a particular notice, means the period of 3 years immediately preceding the date on which the licensee serves the notice.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Authority’s power to obtain information as to disqualified persons

subsection.content: If it appears to the Authority that there is reason to investigate the voting controllers of any voting shares of a licensee, it may require any person whom it has reasonable cause to believe to have, or to be able to provide or obtain, any information as to any present or past voting controllers and their names and addresses and of those persons who act or have acted on their behalf, to give that information to the Authority. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), where the Authority has reasonable cause to believe a person— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a voting controller of voting shares of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to have been such a controller at any time during the relevant period; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to have assisted in or been a party to any transaction involving, in respect of any such voting shares, a change of voting controller,

subsection.continued: then it may, by notice in writing served on the person, require the person—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to confirm or refute that fact; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: if he confirms it, to give such further particulars as may be required under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2) may require the person on whom it is served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to give particulars as to his status as a disqualified person or otherwise at any time during the relevant period;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: where he has at any time during the relevant period been a voting controller, but at the time the notice is served has ceased to be so, to give particulars which are within his knowledge or belief relating to the address and identity of any person who became a voting controller immediately upon his ceasing to be a voting controller; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where he has at any time during the relevant period assisted in or been a party to any transaction involving, in respect of any voting share, a change of voting controller, to give particulars which are within his knowledge or belief relating to the address and identity of any person who became a voting controller upon the change.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (2) shall specify a period within which the requirements of the notice are to be complied with.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice in writing served on a licensee, direct the licensee to exercise its powers of investigation under section 9 in respect of a person named in the notice and, where the Authority gives such a direction— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee shall comply with it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the following shall apply—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the licensee shall, not later than 15 days after the investigation is concluded, give in writing to the Authority any information and particulars received by the licensee as a result of the investigation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: without prejudice to subparagraph (i), where the investigation is not concluded within 3 months beginning on the date the relevant notice under this subsection was served on the licensee, the licensee shall, not later than 15 days beginning on—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the expiry of that 3 months period; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the expiry of every successive period of 3 months before the conclusion of the investigation,

subparagraph.continued: give to the Authority an interim report relating to the information and particulars received by it during the period referred to in sub-subparagraph (A) or (B), as the case may be;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an investigation shall be regarded as concluded when the licensee has made all the inquiries necessary or expedient for the purpose of the investigation and any such inquiry shall be regarded as concluded when a response has been received by the licensee or the time given by it for a response has expired. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.def: In this section, relevant period (有關期間), in relation to a particular notice, means the period of 3 years immediately preceding the date on which the Authority serves the notice. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Additional requirements regarding form and content of licensee’s records

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensee serves a notice under section 9(1), or serves such notice in consequence of a direction under section 10(5), it shall keep a record in the specified form containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of any person on whom it is served; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the particulars received by the licensee in response to the notice.

subsection.content: A licensee shall retain a record mentioned in subsection (1) in accordance with any direction in that behalf given by the Authority under section 16. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Power of Authority to impose restrictions

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a disqualified person is convicted of an offence under section 17(2) or (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person is convicted of an offence under section 17(1), (4), (5) or (6),

subsection.continued: and it appears to the Authority that the offence was committed in relation to any voting share of a licensee, then the Authority may, by notice in writing, direct that the share, which shall be specified in the notice, shall be subject to such of the restrictions mentioned in subsection (3) as are specified in the notice until the Authority makes a further notice under this subsection in respect of the share. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.content: If, in connection with an investigation under section 9 or 10, it appears to the Authority that there is difficulty in ascertaining the relevant facts regarding a person who, in the opinion of the Authority, is or appears to be the voting controller of any voting share of a licensee, then the Authority may, by notice in writing, direct that the share, which shall be specified in the notice, shall be subject to such of the restrictions mentioned in subsection (3) as are specified in the notice until the Authority makes a further notice under this section in respect of the share. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: The restrictions for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2) are that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no voting right can be exercised in respect of the voting share;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no further voting share shall be issued in right of the voting share or under any offer made to the holder of it; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: except in a liquidation, no payment shall be made of any amount due from the licensee on the voting share, whether in respect of capital or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: Where a voting share is subject to a restriction mentioned in subsection (3)(a), an agreement to transfer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the voting share; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a voting share which has not been issued, the right to be issued with it,

subsection.continued: is void.

subsection.content: Where a voting share is subject to a restriction, mentioned in subsection (3)(c) or (d), any agreement to transfer a right to be issued with any other voting share in the right of such voting share, or to receive any payment on it otherwise than on liquidation, is void.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Relaxation and removal of restrictions under section 12

subsection.leadIn: Where a voting share of a licensee is the subject of a notice under section 12(1) or (2), the licensee or any person aggrieved by the notice may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order directing that the share—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall cease to be subject to the restrictions specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be sold, subject to the Court of First Instance’s approval for the sale.

subsection.content: Where the Court of First Instance makes an order under subsection (1)(b), it may also direct that the voting share shall cease to be subject to any restrictions specified in the notice concerned under section 12(1) or (2).

An order under this section directing that a voting share shall cease to be subject to restrictions specified in the notice concerned under section 12(1) or (2), if it is stated to be made with a view to permitting the transfer or directing the sale of the share, may direct that any such restrictions shall continue in whole or in part, in so far as such restrictions relate to a right acquired or offer made before the transfer or sale.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Provision as to proceeds of sale by order of Court of First Instance

subsection.content: Where a voting share of a licensee is sold pursuant to an order under section 13(1)(b), the proceeds of sale, less the costs of the sale, shall be paid into court for the benefit of any person who is beneficially interested in the voting share and any such person may apply to the Court of First Instance for the whole or any part of those proceeds to be paid to him.

Where a person makes an application under subsection (1), the Court of First Instance may order the payment to the applicant of the whole of the proceeds of sale together with any interest thereon or, if any other person had a beneficial interest in the voting share at the time of its sale, the Court of First Instance may apportion the proceeds and interest between the applicant and such other person in proportion to their respective beneficial interests and direct that payment be made accordingly.

Where the Court of First Instance makes an order under section 13(1)(b), it may further order that the costs of an applicant in relation to the application under that section be paid out of the proceeds of sale and, if it makes such an order and the licensee is such an applicant, the licensee shall be entitled to the payment of its costs out of the proceeds before any other applicant is paid any part of the proceeds.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Privilege relating to non-disclosure and confidentiality

subsection.content: A person is not obliged to comply with the requirements of a notice under section 9 if he is for the time being exempted by the Financial Secretary by notice in the Gazette from the operation of section 329 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571). (Amended 5 of 2002 s. 407)

Subject to subsection (4), nothing in this Part shall be construed as requiring the disclosure of information by an authorized institution within the meaning of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), or by a nominee of any such institution, acting as a banker or financial adviser in relation to the affairs of any of its customers.
Subsection (3) shall not apply to the disclosure of the name and address of a voting controller by an authorized institution, or the nominee of such an institution, mentioned in that subsection.
Subject to subsection (6), any information designated as confidential which is received by a licensee or the Authority under this Part shall be treated as confidential. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) shall not be construed as prohibiting the disclosure of information—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: by the licensee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the Authority; (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: in connection with civil proceedings to which the licensee is a party.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Directions of Authority

subsection.content: The Authority may issue directions for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Authority may under that subsection— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the manner in which any document to be used for the purposes of this Part is to be distributed by a licensee, completed and executed by or on behalf of a person to whom the document is distributed and returned to the licensee, and assessed, processed, recorded or reported on by the licensee to the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the manner in which any document to be used for the purposes of this Part is to be distributed by the licensee and returned to the licensee by or on behalf of a person to whom the document is distributed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where a period is not specified for the doing of anything in respect of which the Authority may issue directions under this Part, specify a period; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: impose any duty or obligation on the licensee for the purpose of securing, or assisting the securing of, compliance by the licensee with this Part.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Offences

subsection.content: A person who, in purported compliance with any duty or requirement to give information under this Part, gives, orally or in writing, information which is false in any material particular and which he knows or ought reasonably to have known was false in a material particular, commits an offence.

A voting controller who fails to comply with the requirements of a notice served on the controller under section 8(1) within the period specified in the notice for complying with it commits an offence.
A person who fails to comply with the requirements of a notice served on him under section 9(1) within the period specified in the notice for complying with it commits an offence.
A person who fails to comply with the requirements of a notice served on him under section 10(2) within the period specified in the notice for complying with it commits an offence.

A person who votes on a poll at a general meeting of a licensee, whether in person or by proxy, in respect of a voting share which, to his knowledge, is for the time being subject to a restriction under section 12(3)(b), or appoints a proxy to vote in respect of the share, commits an offence.

A person who being the holder of a voting share which, to his knowledge, is for the time being subject to a restriction under section 12(3) or having a right to be issued with another voting share in the right of the first-mentioned share, or to receive any payment in respect of the first-mentioned share otherwise than in a liquidation, enters into an agreement which is void under section 12(4) or (5) commits an offence.
A person who commits an offence under this section is liable on conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Prosecution of offences and limitation on institution of proceedings

subsection.content: Without affecting the powers of the Secretary for Justice in relation to the prosecution of criminal offences, prosecution for an offence under this Part may be instituted by the Authority. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

Notwithstanding section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), any information or complaint relating to an offence under this Part may be tried if it is laid or made, as the case may be, at any time within 3 years beginning on the date of the commission of the offence or within 12 months beginning on the first discovery of the offence by the prosecutor, whichever period expires first.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Restrictions on Voting Control Held by Unqualified Voting Controllers (Not Applicable in Relation to Domestic Pay Television Programme Service Licence)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Restrictions on percentage of voting control of unqualified voting controllers

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), notwithstanding anything contained in the articles of association of a licensee or any provision of any law apart from this section, where any question or matter is to be determined by a poll at any general meeting of the licensee, the following shall apply— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no vote shall be cast on the poll, whether in person or by proxy, other than by or by proxy on behalf of any person who, at the time of the general meeting, is a registered shareholder of voting shares of the licensee in respect of which a document mentioned in section 22(1)(b) has, in accordance with any direction in that behalf issued by the Authority under section 30, been completed and returned to the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the total voting control exercised by unqualified voting controllers would otherwise exceed, in the aggregate, 49% of the total voting control exercised on the poll by both qualified and unqualified voting controllers, the votes cast on the poll by unqualified voting controllers shall, for the purpose of determining the question or matter, be reduced by multiplying those votes by the percentage determined by the formula specified in paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the formula for the purposes of paragraph (b) is—

tr.td: the percentage of the total votes cast on the poll, the voting controllers of which are unqualified voting controllers.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything contained in the articles of association of the licensee, this section shall not apply— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the question or matter which is to be determined by a poll at any general meeting of the licensee is the creation of different classes of shares in the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the share capital of the licensee is for the time being divided into different classes of shares, to the variation, including abrogation, of any special rights attaching to any such classes of shares.

subsection.content: The Authority may at any time before, at or during a general meeting of a licensee, direct the licensee orally or by notice in writing to conduct a poll upon any resolution and, where such a direction is given, the licensee shall comply with it.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Control limits by unqualified voting controller subject to approval of Authority

subsection.leadIn: An unqualified voting controller must not, without the prior approval in writing of the Authority— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28; 23 of 2020 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: acquire; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: exercise or cause or permit to be exercised,

subsection.continued: 5% or more but less than 10%, or 10% or more but not more than 15%, or more than 15%, in the aggregate, of the total voting control of a licensee. (Amended 23 of 2020 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: If an unqualified voting controller holds more than 15%, in the aggregate, of the total voting control of a licensee in contravention of subsection (1), despite—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: anything contained in the articles of association of the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any provision of the laws of Hong Kong apart from this section,

subsection.continued: the controller must not exercise or cause or permit to be exercised, in relation to any question or matter arising at a general meeting of the licensee, voting rights exceeding, in the aggregate, 15% of the total voting control of the licensee. (Replaced 23 of 2020 s. 5)

subsection.content: The Authority may, in respect of any unqualified voting controller who is in contravention of subsection (1), by notice in writing served on him, give such directions as appear to it to be required to effect a cesser of the contravention. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3) shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the directions given under subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a period within which the directions are to be complied with.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall be construed as restricting or otherwise affecting the power of a person to transfer a voting share.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Restriction on unqualified voting controllers acting in association with other voting controllers

subsection.leadIn: Where a person being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a qualified voting controller; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an unqualified voting controller,

subsection.continued: holds or acquires voting control of the voting shares of a licensee as an associate of an unqualified voting controller and it appears to the Authority that a purpose of the holding or acquisition is to avoid a restriction imposed on an unqualified voting controller under this Part, then the Authority may, by notice in writing served on any voting controller whom it believes to be a party to the holding or acquisition, give directions to the voting controller which appear to the Authority to be necessary to— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: effect a cesser of the holding or acquisition; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: ensure compliance with the restriction.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the directions are given for the purpose of subsection (1)(i), those directions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the directions are given for the purpose of subsection (1)(ii), those directions and the restriction required to be complied with; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the period within which the directions are required to be complied with.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall be construed as restricting or otherwise affecting a person’s power to transfer a voting share.

Where 2 or more persons act together to hold or acquire the voting control of the voting shares of a licensee, then, for the purposes of this Part, each of those persons shall be regarded in relation to the voting shares of the licensee as being an associate of the other and of any other person acting on the directions of any of them to hold or to acquire voting control over those voting shares.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Duty of licensee to notify Authority in relation to general meetings, etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a licensee shall, in relation to any general meeting and in accordance with any relevant directions given by the Authority under section 30— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: distribute to each person whose name appeared in the licensee’s register immediately before the distribution, a document relating to the voting control attaching to the voting shares registered in that person’s name, to be completed and returned to the licensee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on receiving a request in writing from a registered shareholder, in that behalf, by reference to the document mentioned in paragraph (b), notify in writing the registered shareholder of the number and identity of the voting shares of the licensee in respect of which that registered shareholder is a person described in section 19(1)(a);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by reference to the document mentioned in paragraph (b), notify in writing the Authority of the total number of voting shares held by any person mentioned in section 19(1)(a) and controlled by unqualified voting controllers and by qualified voting controllers and the proportion, expressed as a percentage, that the former bears to the whole;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: notify in writing the Authority of the name, address, and such further particulars as the Authority may require of all unqualified voting controllers who, by reference to the document mentioned in paragraph (b), hold 5% or more of the total voting control of the licensee; and (Amended 23 of 2020 s. 5)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: notify in writing the Authority as to the details of the conduct of any poll held at the general meeting, including particulars of any calculation of voting control under section 19(1)(b), and such further particulars as the Authority may require. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.content: Where a person to whom a document is distributed under subsection (1)(b) is unable, from his own knowledge or belief, to complete the document or has no authority to do so, he shall, where he knows the name and address of any other person whom he has reason to believe may be able to complete or to assist in the completion of the document or who has authority to do so, send the document to that person.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Licensee’s power to investigate voting controllers

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensee knows or has reasonable cause to believe a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a voting controller of voting shares of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to have been such a controller at any time during the relevant period; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to have assisted in or been a party to any transaction involving, in respect of any such voting shares, a change of voting controller,

subsection.continued: then the licensee may, by notice in writing served on the person, require the person—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to confirm or refute that fact; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: if he confirms it, to give such further particulars as may be required under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) may require the person on whom it is served—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: where he has at any time during the relevant period been a voting controller, but at the time the notice is served has ceased to be so, to give particulars which are within his knowledge or belief relating to the address and identity of any person who became a voting controller immediately upon his ceasing to be a voting controller; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where he has at any time during the relevant period assisted in or been a party to any transaction involving, in respect of any voting share, a change of voting controller, to give particulars which are within his knowledge or belief relating to the address and identity of any person who became a voting controller upon the change.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) shall specify a period within which the requirements of the notice are to be complied with.

Where any particulars are given to a licensee under this section, it shall, not later than 15 days beginning on the date it receives the particulars, give the Authority notice in writing of the particulars. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.def: In this section, relevant period (有關期間), in relation to a particular notice, means the period of 3 years immediately preceding the date on which the licensee serves the notice.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Authority’s power to obtain information as to voting controllers

subsection.content: If it appears to the Authority that there is reason to investigate the voting controllers of any voting shares of a licensee, it may require any person whom it has reasonable cause to believe to have, or to be able to provide or obtain, any information as to any present or past voting controllers and their names and addresses and of those persons who act or have acted on their behalf, to give that information to the Authority. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), where the Authority has reasonable cause to believe a person— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a voting controller of voting shares of the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to have been such a controller at any time during the relevant period; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to have assisted in or been a party to any transaction involving, in respect of any such voting shares, a change of voting controller,

subsection.continued: then it may, by notice in writing served on the person, require the person—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to confirm or refute that fact; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: if he confirms it, to give such further particulars as may be required under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2) may require the person on whom it is served—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: where he has at any time during the relevant period been a voting controller, but at the time the notice is served has ceased to be so, to give particulars which are within his knowledge or belief relating to the address and identity of any person who became a voting controller immediately upon his ceasing to be a voting controller; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where he has at any time during the relevant period assisted in or been a party to any transaction involving, in respect of any voting share, a change of voting controller, to give particulars which are within his knowledge or belief relating to the address and identity of any person who became a voting controller upon the change.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (2) shall specify a period within which the requirements of the notice are to be complied with.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice in writing served on a licensee, direct the licensee to exercise its powers of investigation under section 23 in respect of a person named in the notice and, where the Authority gives such a direction— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee shall comply with it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the following shall apply—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the licensee shall, not later than 15 days after the investigation is concluded, give in writing to the Authority any information and particulars received by the licensee as a result of the investigation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: without prejudice to subparagraph (i), where the investigation is not concluded within 3 months beginning on the date the relevant notice under this subsection was served on the licensee, the licensee shall, not later than 15 days beginning on—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the expiry of that 3 months period; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the expiry of every successive period of 3 months before the conclusion of the investigation,

subparagraph.continued: give to the Authority an interim report relating to the information and particulars received by it during the period referred to in sub-subparagraph (A) or (B), as the case may be;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an investigation shall be regarded as concluded when the licensee has made all the inquiries necessary or expedient for the purpose of the investigation and any such inquiry shall be regarded as concluded when a response has been received by the licensee or the time given by the licensee for a response has expired. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.def: In this section, relevant period (有關期間), in relation to a particular notice, means the period of 3 years immediately preceding the date on which the Authority serves the notice. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Additional requirements regarding form and content of licensee’s records

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensee serves a notice under section 23(1), or serves such notice in consequence of a direction under section 24(5), it shall keep a record in the specified form containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of any person on whom it is served; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the particulars received by the licensee in response to the notice.

subsection.content: A licensee shall retain a record mentioned in subsection (1) in accordance with any direction in that behalf given by the Authority under section 30. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s26
section.heading: Power of Authority to impose restrictions

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unqualified voting controller is convicted of an offence under section 31(2) or (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person is convicted of an offence under section 31(1), (5), (6), (7) or (8),

subsection.continued: and it appears to the Authority that the offence was committed in relation to any voting share of a licensee, then the Authority may, by notice in writing, direct that the share, which shall be specified in the notice, shall be subject to such of the restrictions mentioned in subsection (3) as are specified in the notice until the Authority makes a further notice under this subsection in respect of the share. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.content: If, in connection with an investigation under section 23 or 24, it appears to the Authority that there is difficulty in ascertaining the relevant facts regarding a person who, in the opinion of the Authority, is or appears to be the voting controller of any voting share of a licensee, then the Authority may by notice in writing direct that the share, which shall be specified in the notice, shall be subject to such of the restrictions mentioned in subsection (3), as are specified in the notice until the Authority makes a further notice under this subsection in respect of the share. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: The restrictions for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2) are that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no voting right can be exercised in respect of the voting share;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no further voting share shall be issued in right of the voting share or under any offer made to the holder of it; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: except in a liquidation, no payment shall be made of any amount due from the licensee on the voting share, whether in respect of capital or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: Where a voting share is subject to a restriction mentioned in subsection (3)(a), an agreement to transfer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the voting share; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a share which has not been issued, the right to be issued with it,

subsection.continued: is void.

subsection.content: Where a voting share is subject to a restriction mentioned in subsection (3)(c) or (d), any agreement to transfer a right to be issued with any other voting share in the right of such voting share, or to receive any payment on it otherwise than on liquidation, is void.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Relaxation and removal of restriction under section 26

subsection.leadIn: Where a voting share of a licensee is the subject of a notice under section 26(1) or (2), the licensee or any person aggrieved by the notice may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order directing that the share—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall cease to be subject to the restrictions specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be sold, subject to the Court of First Instance’s approval for the sale.

subsection.content: Where the Court of First Instance makes an order under subsection (1)(b), it may also direct that the voting share shall cease to be subject to any restrictions specified in the notice concerned under section 26(1) or (2).

An order under this section directing that a voting share shall cease to be subject to restrictions specified in the notice concerned under section 26(1) or (2), if it is stated to be made with a view to permitting the transfer or directing the sale of the share, may direct that any such restrictions shall continue in whole or in part, in so far as such restrictions relate to a right acquired or offer made before the transfer or sale.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Provision as to proceeds of sale by order of Court of First Instance

subsection.content: Where a voting share of a licensee is sold pursuant to an order under section 27(1)(b), the proceeds of sale, less the costs of the sale, shall be paid into court for the benefit of any person who is beneficially interested in the voting share and any such person may apply to the Court of First Instance for the whole or any part of those proceeds to be paid to him.

Where a person makes an application under subsection (1), the Court of First Instance may order the payment to the applicant of the whole of the proceeds of sale together with any interest thereon or, if any other person had a beneficial interest in the voting share at the time of its sale, the Court of First Instance may apportion the proceeds and interest between the applicant and such other person in proportion to their respective beneficial interests and direct that payment be made accordingly.
