Where the Court of First Instance makes an order under section 27(1)(b), it may further order that the costs of an applicant in relation to the application under that section be paid out of the proceeds of sale and, if it makes such an order and the licensee is such an applicant, the licensee shall be entitled to the payment of its costs out of the proceeds before any other applicant is paid any part of the proceeds.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Privilege relating to non-disclosure and confidentiality

subsection.content: A person is not obliged to comply with the requirements of a notice under section 23 if he is for the time being exempted by the Financial Secretary by notice in the Gazette from the operation of section 329 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571). (Amended 5 of 2002 s. 407)

Subject to subsection (4), nothing in this Part shall be construed as requiring the disclosure of information by an authorized institution within the meaning of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), or by a nominee of any such institution, acting as a banker or financial adviser in relation to the affairs of any of its customers.
Subsection (3) shall not apply to the disclosure of the name and address of a voting controller by an authorized institution, or the nominee of such an institution, mentioned in that subsection.
Subject to subsection (6), any information which is furnished by a person in confidence under this Part shall be treated as confidential.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) shall not be construed as prohibiting the disclosure of information—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: by the licensee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the Authority; (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: in connection with civil proceedings to which the licensee is a party.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Directions of Authority

subsection.content: The Authority may issue directions for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Authority may under that subsection— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the manner in which any document to be used for the purposes of this Part is to be distributed by a licensee, completed and executed by or on behalf of a person to whom the document is distributed and returned to the licensee, and assessed, processed, recorded or reported on by the licensee to the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the manner in which any document to be used for the purposes of this Part is to be distributed by the licensee and returned to the licensee by or on behalf of a person to whom the document is distributed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where a period is not specified for the doing of anything in respect of which the Authority may issue directions under this Part, specify a period; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: impose any duty or obligation on the licensee for the purpose of securing, or assisting the securing of, compliance by the licensee with this Part.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Offences

subsection.content: A person who, in purported compliance with any duty or requirement to give information under this Part, gives, orally or in writing, information which is false in any material particular and which he knows or ought reasonably to have known was false in a material particular, commits an offence.

An unqualified voting controller who fails to comply with the requirements of a notice served on the controller under section 20 within the period specified in the notice for complying with it commits an offence.

A voting controller who fails to comply with the requirements of a notice served on the controller under section 21(1) within the period specified in the notice for complying with it commits an offence.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with section 22(2) commits an offence.
A person who fails to comply with the requirements of a notice served on him under section 23 within the period specified in the notice for complying with it commits an offence.
A person who fails to comply with the requirements of a notice served on him under section 24 within the period specified in the notice for complying with it commits an offence.

A person who votes on a poll at a general meeting of a licensee, whether in person or by proxy, in respect of a voting share which, to his knowledge, is for the time being subject to a restriction under section 26(3)(b), or appoints a proxy to vote in respect of the share, commits an offence.

A person who being the holder of a voting share which, to his knowledge, is for the time being subject to a restriction under section 26(3) or having a right to be issued with another voting share in the right of the first-mentioned share, or to receive any payment in respect of the first-mentioned share otherwise than in a liquidation, enters into an agreement which is void under section 26(4) or (5) commits an offence.
A person who commits an offence under this section is liable on conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Prosecution of offences and limitation on institution of proceedings

subsection.content: Without affecting the powers of the Secretary for Justice in relation to the prosecution of criminal offences, prosecution for an offence under this Part may be instituted by the Authority. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

Notwithstanding section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), any information or complaint relating to an offence under this Part may be tried if it is laid or made, as the case may be, at any time within 3 years beginning on the date of the commission of the offence or within 12 months beginning on the first discovery of the offence by the prosecutor, whichever period expires first.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Restriction on Domestic Free or Pay Television Programme Service Licensees Exercising Control on Disqualified Persons

section.name: s33
section.heading: Restrictions on licensees exercising control on disqualified person without Chief Executive in Council’s approval

subsection.leadIn: A licensee shall not exercise control on a disqualified person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the Chief Executive in Council, on application in the specified form by a licensee, is satisfied that the public interest so requires and approves otherwise; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except in accordance with such conditions as are specified in the approval.

subsection.leadIn: In considering public interest for the purposes of subsection (1), account shall be taken of, but not limited to, the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the effect on competition in the relevant service market;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extent to which viewers will be offered more diversified television programme choices;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the impact on the development of the broadcasting industry; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the overall benefits to the economy.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Items Which are not to be Regarded as Newspapers for the Purpose of Paragraph (c) of Definition of Newspaper in Section 2(1)

tr.td: Collections of photographic images (with or without captions)
Commercial advertisements and commercial advertising circulars and brochures
Company and partnership reports and company prospectuses
Information sheets and newsletters relating to clubs, educational institutions, professional associations, societies, trade unions and other organizations
Racing tips, racing form reports and other related materials
Technical or technology journals and catalogues

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Services not to be Regarded as Television Programme Services

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: A service consisting of the conveyance, without variation or alteration of contents, of a licensed service—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by means of a telecommunications network; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under an interconnection agreement (within the meaning of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106)) between the licensee of the licensed service and the owner or operator of the telecommunications network.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consisting of the conveyance of a programme service exclusively between points specified by the person transmitting the programme service and the person receiving it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is not made available to any other person.

section.name: s3
section.content: The provision of a transactional service, that is, a service which affords facilities to conduct from the place of reception of the service, using the same means of telecommunications by which the service is provided, transactions for the receipt of goods or services, or both, other than a transaction which consists of ordering and receiving a service that includes television programmes by the same means of telecommunications.

section.name: s4
section.content: Any service (such as the services commonly known as video conferencing and video telephony) in which material is transmitted by means of telecommunications, and an essential feature of the service is that while the material is being transmitted there will or can be sent from the place of reception of the service, by the same means of telecommunications, material (other than signals sent for the operation or control of the service) for reception by the person providing the service or other persons receiving it.

section.name: s5
section.content: Any service provided on the service commonly known as the INTERNET.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: A service consisting of television programmes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which do not primarily target Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uplinked from a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: transmitted from a satellite; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: intended for general reception in that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the programmes are not encrypted or, where encrypted—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the originator of the programmes has published a notice in a Chinese language newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong, and in an English language newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong, stating that the programmes are intended for general reception and that no fee will be charged for the right to view or listen to any such programmes in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the Authority states in writing that it is satisfied that the programmes are intended for general reception and that no fee will be charged for the right to view or listen to any such programmes in Hong Kong; and (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no fee is in fact charged for the right to view or listen to any such programme in Hong Kong.

section.name: s7
section.content: A service consisting of a closed circuit television system comprising a television transmitter unit, with or without an associated audio system, connected to reception units by wire or other material substance which does not cross a public street or unleased Government land, where the service is operated solely for internal information or security information purposes solely for users of the reception units.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Domestic Free Television Programme Service Supplementary Provisions

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: licence (牌照) means a domestic free television programme service licence;
licensee (持牌人) means the holder of a licence;
service (服務) means a domestic free television programme service the subject of a licence.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Television programmes supplied by Government

subsection.leadIn: Where a requirement is made on a licensee pursuant to a condition to include in its service, without charge, a television programme supplied by the Government or the Authority— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement may include the inclusion in its service, of television programmes supplied by the Government or the Authority, during the 3 hours commencing at 7 p.m., on any day from Monday to Friday inclusive;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless the licensee consents otherwise, the number of such hours of television programmes supplied by the Government or the Authority for inclusion in its service during the hours mentioned in paragraph (a) shall not be required to exceed, in any one day, 30 minutes in duration, in aggregate or otherwise;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to the operation of paragraphs (a) and (b), if the licensee’s service is not provided on demand, the duration of the television programmes supplied by the Government or the Authority shall not be required to exceed, in aggregate or otherwise, any of the following— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 2 1/2 hours in any period of 24 hours commencing at 6 a.m.;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a service in the Chinese language, 12 hours in any week; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in the case of a service in the English language, 6 hours in any week. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (1) shall be construed to prejudice the operation of section 19 of this Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Duration of licence

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by notice in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the period of validity of a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order a licence to be reviewed within such period as is specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A licence shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), be valid for such period as is specified in a notice under subsection (1)(a) applicable to the licence, and shall, unless otherwise provided under this Ordinance, cease to have effect on the expiration of that period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be subject to review—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within that period on such dates as are specified in the licence for the purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: within such period as is specified in a notice under subsection (1)(b) applicable to the licence.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Disqualified persons not to increase control of licensee

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 6, no disqualified person who exercises control of a licensee shall increase such control—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by increasing the percentage of voting shares of the licensee which he holds as the beneficial owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as the result of any change of office held by him in the licensee.

subsection.content: A disqualified person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Circumstances in which disqualified person may increase control of licensee
section.leadIn: On the application of a licensee, the Chief Executive in Council may, if he is satisfied that the public interest so requires, approve—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an increase in the control exercised by a disqualified person in the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the introduction of a disqualified person to exercise control of the licensee.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Licensee to include certain statement in prospectus
section.content: A licensee shall ensure that a clear statement of the effect of section 8 of this Ordinance, of Schedule 1 and of sections 5 and 6 is made in any prospectus, within the meaning of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), issued at any time in respect of the licensee. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Effect of Non-Renewal or Revocation of Licence

section.name: s8
section.heading: Notice of non-renewal or revocation of licence

subsection.leadIn: Where the Chief Executive in Council decides under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 11(5) of this Ordinance not to extend or renew a licence, he shall cause notice in writing of the decision to be served on the licensee at least 12 months before the expiry of the validity of the licence under section 4(2)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 32 of this Ordinance to revoke a licence, he shall cause notice in writing of the decision to be served on the licensee as soon as is practicable after the decision to revoke the licence.

subsection.content: Where it is necessary for the purpose of complying with the requirement as to length of notice in subsection (1)(a), the Chief Executive in Council may extend the term of a licence (but no such extension shall continue in force any exclusive right to provide the licensed service).

section.name: s9
section.heading: Direction to Financial Secretary to purchase land and property belonging, etc. to licensee, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where a notice is served under section 8(1)(a) or (b) in respect of a licence, or notice of a decision to revoke a licence is served under section 32(4) of this Ordinance, the Chief Executive in Council may direct The Financial Secretary Incorporated to purchase any property (including land) belonging to and used or kept by the licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the period of validity of the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Where a notice is served under section 32(4) of this Ordinance or section 8, then, not later than 12 months beginning on the date the notice is served, The Financial Secretary Incorporated shall do the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other property, purchase the entirety of the property or acquire a licence to use the property for a period not exceeding 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: The consideration for the purchase of property under subsection (2) shall be an amount equal to the open market value of the property at the date of the decision not to extend or renew, or to revoke, as the case may be, the licence concerned as between a willing buyer and a willing seller but without regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: loss of profit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: goodwill;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the right of pre-emption;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the cost of related capital; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: all the property being placed on the market at the same time.

subsection.content: In default of an agreement between The Financial Secretary Incorporated and a licensee as regards the consideration mentioned in subsection (3), the consideration shall be determined by arbitration under the Arbitration Ordinance (Cap. 609) and, for that purpose, The Financial Secretary Incorporated and the licensee shall be regarded as having made an arbitration agreement within the meaning of that Ordinance whose provisions shall be deemed to include a provision that that consideration shall, in the absence of agreement, be determined by a single arbitrator. (Amended 17 of 2010 s. 112)

Where any land is purchased under this section, the licensee concerned shall execute an assignment in favour of The Financial Secretary Incorporated and The Financial Secretary Incorporated shall register the assignment in the Land Registry within 30 days of the execution of the assignment.

subsection.leadIn: Any property, other than land, purchased under this section shall vest in The Financial Secretary Incorporated—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of a decision to revoke the licence concerned under section 32 of this Ordinance, when the revocation takes effect or when an offer for the purchase is made by The Financial Secretary Incorporated, whichever is the later,

subsection.continued: and upon such vesting all the rights of the licensee in that property shall cease and determine.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall be construed as conferring on a licensee any right to require The Financial Secretary Incorporated to purchase any property owned by the licensee.

Where land is purchased under this section, The Financial Secretary Incorporated shall, within 30 days beginning on the date the land is purchased, register in the Land Registry by memorial a declaration that the land has been so purchased.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, licensee (持牌人) includes any subsidiary of the licensee.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Minimum duration of television programme service
section.content: The duration of each language television programme service provided under a deemed licence, within the meaning of Schedule 8 to this Ordinance, falling within section 2(1) of that Schedule shall be not less than 5 hours for each day.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Advertising

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the aggregate advertising time of a television programme service shall not exceed 10 minutes per clock hour between the period from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m. each day and at other times the aggregate advertising time shall not exceed 18% of the total time the service is provided in that period.

Where the Authority is satisfied that compliance with subsection (1) would adversely affect, or would have adversely affected, the standards of presentation of a television programme, or of television programmes belonging to a class of television programmes, of a television programme service, it may, by notice in writing served on the licensee concerned, exempt that television programme, or those television programmes, as the case may be, from compliance with that subsection in the manner specified in the notice. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Certain advertisements prohibited
section.content: A licensee shall not include in its service any advertisement of a religious or political nature or concerned with any industrial dispute.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Annual payment of fees

subsection.content: Subject to section 5 of Schedule 8 to this Ordinance, a licensee shall pay annually to the Authority a prescribed licence fee and such other fees as may be prescribed. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

In a licence issued or renewed under this Ordinance before the commencement date* of the Communications Authority Ordinance (Cap. 616), any condition providing for the payment of the licence fee to the Government is to be construed as a condition providing for the payment of the licence fee to the Authority. (Added 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Procedural provisions for recovery of licence fees, etc.

subsection.content: A licence fee or other fee or charge certified in writing by the Authority to be owing to the Authority shall be recoverable as a civil debt.
A certificate in writing purporting to be made under subsection (1) shall be prima facie evidence of the debt specified in the certificate.
A licence fee, and other fees and charges, owing by a licensee to the Authority shall constitute a first charge on the property belonging to the licensee.

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Domestic Pay Television Programme Service Supplementary Provisions

section.name: s1
section.heading: Application of Schedule 4
section.content: The provisions of Schedule 4, except sections 3, 10 and 11 of that Schedule, shall apply to and in relation to a domestic pay television programme service licensee and its licensed service as they apply to and in relation to a domestic free television programme service licensee and its licensed service.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Non-Domestic Television Programme Service Supplementary Provisions

section.heading: Application of Schedule 4
section.content: The provisions of section 12, and of Part 4, of Schedule 4 shall apply to and in relation to a non-domestic television programme service and its licensed service as it applies to and in relation to a domestic free television programme service licensee and its licensed service.

schedule.name: sch7
schedule.heading: Other Licensable Television Programme Service Supplementary Provisions

section.name: s1
section.heading: Restriction on exercising control of other licensees
section.content: An other licensable television programme service licensee, the persons exercising control of the licensee, and the associates of the licensee and those persons exercising control of the licensee, shall not hold such number of other licensable television programme service licences, or exercise control of other licensable television programme service licensees, the combined services of which are intended or available for reception by an audience of more than 200 000 specified premises.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application of Schedule 4
section.content: The provisions of sections 12, 13 and 14 of Schedule 4 shall apply to and in relation to an other licensable television programme service licensee and its licensed service as they apply to and in relation to a domestic free television programme service licensee and its licensed service.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: commercial television broadcasting licence (商營電視廣播牌照) means a commercial television broadcasting licence within the meaning of section 2(1) of the repealed Ordinance and which was in force immediately before the relevant day or which was to come into force on or after that day;

def.name: DeemedLicence
def.leadIn: deemed licence (當作批給的牌照) means a licence deemed under section 2(1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) to be—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a licence granted under this Ordinance;

section.def: hotel television service licence (酒店電視服務牌照) means a hotel television service licence granted under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) and which was in force immediately before the relevant day or which was to come into force on or after that day;

programme service licence (節目服務牌照) means a programme service licence within the meaning of section 2(1) of the repealed Ordinance and which was in force immediately before the relevant day or which was to come into force on or after that day;
repealed Ordinance (已廢除條例) means the Television Ordinance (Cap. 52) repealed under section 44(1) of this Ordinance;

subscription television broadcasting licence (收費電視廣播牌照) means a subscription television broadcasting licence within the meaning of section 2(1) of the repealed Ordinance and which was in force immediately before the relevant day or which was to come into force on or after that day;

telecommunications licence (電訊牌照) means a licence entitled “Satellite Television Uplink and Downlink Licence” granted under section 7 of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) and which was in force immediately before the relevant day or which was to come into force on or after that day.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Licences under repealed Ordinance deemed to be licences under Ordinance, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A commercial television broadcasting licence shall be deemed to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a domestic free television programme service licence granted under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licence granted under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106),

subsection.continued: for—

paragraph.name: i
ii
paragraph.content: if the licence was to come into force on or after the relevant day, the period of validity of the licence commencing on the day the licence was to come into force,

subsection.continued: and the provisions of this Ordinance and the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), as the case may require, shall apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: A subscription television broadcasting licence shall be deemed to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a domestic pay television programme service licence granted under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licence granted under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106),

subsection.continued: for—

paragraph.name: i
ii
paragraph.content: if the licence was to come into force on or after the relevant day, the period of validity of the licence commencing on the day the licence was to come into force,

subsection.continued: and the provisions of this Ordinance and the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), as the case may require, shall apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: A programme service licence shall be deemed to be a domestic pay television programme service licence granted under this Ordinance for—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the licence was to come into force on or after the relevant day, the period of validity of the licence commencing on the day the licence was to come into force,

subsection.continued: and the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: A telecommunications licence shall be deemed to be a non-domestic television programme service licence granted under this Ordinance for—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the licence was to come into force on or after the relevant day, the period of validity of the licence commencing on the day the licence was to come into force,

subsection.continued: and the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: A hotel television service licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall be deemed to be an other licensable television programme service licence granted under this Ordinance for—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

paragraph.continued: and the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply accordingly;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is renewed under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) before the expiration of 12 months immediately following the relevant day shall continue to be deemed to be an other licensable television programme service licence granted under this Ordinance for the period of validity of the licence as so renewed, and the provision of this Ordinance shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Provisions of deemed licences deemed to be conditions specified in licences
section.content: The provisions of a deemed licence shall be deemed to be conditions specified in the licence, and, accordingly, the licensee shall comply with the deemed conditions except that, where there is any conflict between the deemed conditions and the provisions of this Ordinance or the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), then the provisions of this Ordinance or the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), as the case may require, shall prevail over the deemed conditions.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Disapplication of certain provisions of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Section 5 of this Ordinance shall not apply to a broadcasting service consisting of a television programme service lawfully provided by a person pursuant to an agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lawfully entered into before the specified day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to lawfully use facilities in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which are not owned (including beneficially owned) by that person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to uplink the service to a satellite.

subsection.leadIn: Section 13 of this Ordinance shall not apply to an agreement lawfully entered into before the specified day if, and only if, the agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to be lawful apart from that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not amended in any way whatsoever apart from any amendment made to mitigate the conduct in contravention of section 13(1) of this Ordinance provided or permitted, whether directly or indirectly, under the agreement.

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) shall expire on the second anniversary of the specified day. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: Section 21 of this Ordinance shall not apply to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who was, on the specified day, lawfully exercising control of a corporation holding a licence falling within section 2(1), (2) or (3); and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: immediately before the commencement* of this subsection, a person was not a disqualified person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to a licensee; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by virtue of falling within paragraph (ii) of the proviso to the definition of disqualified person in section 2(1) of the repealed Ordinance (the proviso); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence, within the meaning of section 2(1) of the repealed Ordinance, of which the licensee referred to in paragraph (a)(i) was the holder immediately before the commencement* of this subsection is a deemed licence,

subsection.continued: then the person is not a disqualified person for the purposes of section 3 of Schedule 1— (Amended 23 of 2020 s. 8)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in relation to the deemed licence and the licensee;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: to the extent only that the person was not a disqualified person by virtue of falling within paragraph (ii) of the proviso; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: until such time, if any, as the person ceases to fall within paragraph (ii) of the proviso.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (5)(iii), the proviso referred to in that subsection shall be deemed never to have been repealed.

subsection.def: In this section, specified day (指明日期) means 28 January 2000.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Payment of annual fees

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a deemed licence falling within section 2(1), (2) or (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Financial Secretary may, by notice in writing served on the licensee, specify the fee to be paid to the Government by the licensee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the year commencing on the relevant day; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not later than 30 days after the relevant day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 13 of Schedule 4 to this Ordinance shall not apply to the licensee until the expiration of that year.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a deemed licence falling within section 2(4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the licensee shall continue to comply with the provisions of the licence relating to a licence fee until—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the expiration of the licence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the surrender of the licence for another licence,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 13 of Schedule 4 to this Ordinance shall not apply to the licensee until the occurrence of the event mentioned in paragraph (a)(i) or (ii).

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a deemed licence falling within section 2(5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the licensee shall continue to comply with the provisions of the licence relating to a licence fee until—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the expiration of the licence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the surrender of the licence for another licence,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: section 13 of Schedule 4 to this Ordinance shall not apply to the licensee until—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the occurrence of the event mentioned in paragraph (a)(i) or (ii); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the licence held by the licensee does not specify a licence fee to be paid by the licensee to the Government.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1)(a) served on a licensee shall be deemed to be a condition specified in the deemed licence held by the licensee requiring the licensee to pay to the Government the fee specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensee has before the relevant day paid an annual fee for a deemed licence falling within section 2(1), (2) or (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period for which that fee has been paid would, but for the commencement* of section 44(1) of this Ordinance, expire on or after the relevant day; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensee has paid the fee required by subsection (1)(a),

subsection.continued: then the Financial Secretary shall remit to the licensee so much of the annual fee referred to in paragraph (c) as is equivalent to so much of the fee referred to in paragraph (a) which, on a pro rata basis, relates to so much of the period referred to in paragraph (b) which would, but for the commencement* of section 44(1) of this Ordinance, run on and after the relevant day.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Suspended licences
section.content: Where any licence falling within section 2(1), (2) or (3) was, immediately before the relevant day, suspended under the repealed Ordinance, then that licence shall, in the like manner, be deemed to be suspended under this Ordinance for the unexpired portion of the period of suspension left to run on that day, and the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Actions, etc. under repealed Ordinance deemed to be done under Ordinance
section.content: Where an act, matter or thing has been done under the repealed Ordinance to or in relation to a licensee within the meaning of section 2(1) of that Ordinance, then to the extent that but for the enactment of this Ordinance that act, matter or thing would on or after the relevant day have had any force or effect or been in operation, that act, matter or thing shall, in the like manner, be deemed to have been done under this Ordinance to or in relation to the licensee as if, on the relevant day, that act, matter or thing were, to that extent, done under this Ordinance to or in relation to the licensee, and the provisions of this Ordinance shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Section 23 of Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance

subsection.content: Subject to sections 2 to 7 inclusive, section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) shall apply to the repeal effected by section 44(1) of this Ordinance.

It is hereby declared that a royalty within the meaning of the repealed Ordinance payable by a licensee (or former licensee) within the meaning of that Ordinance is payable on a pro rata basis in respect of that portion of the licensee’s (or former licensee’s) accounting year which has effluxed before the relevant day, and subsection (1) shall apply accordingly.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Deemed licence may be surrendered
section.content: Nothing in this Schedule shall operate to prevent a licensee which is the holder of a deemed licence from surrendering the deemed licence to the Chief Executive in Council or the Authority, as the case may require, in return for a licence granted under this Ordinance which, in the opinion of the Chief Executive in Council or the Authority, as the case may require, is equivalent to the deemed licence.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Certain Codes of Practice applicable for interim period for licensees that are holders of deemed licence

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Code of Practice (old Code) within the meaning of section 2 of the repealed Ordinance was in force immediately before the relevant day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensee who is the holder of a deemed licence was required to comply with the old Code immediately before the relevant day,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the old Code shall, in relation to the licensee, be deemed to be a Code of Practice within the meaning of section 2 of this Ordinance until the date on which a Code of Practice approved under section 3 of this Ordinance, and expressed to be in substitution for the old Code, comes into effect; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (iii), the licensee shall comply with the old Code until that date; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the old Code shall be read and have effect with such modifications as are necessary to take into account the provisions of this Ordinance,

section.continued: and the provisions of this Ordinance (including sections 23(2)(d), 24, 28(2)(d), 30(2)(d), 31(2)(b)(i)(D) and 32(4)(c)(i)(D) of this Ordinance) shall be construed accordingly.

schedule.name: sch10
schedule.heading: Transitional and Savings Provisions—Broadcasting and Telecommunications Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Broadcasting and Telecommunications Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020 (23 of 2020);
*commencement date (生效日期) means the day on which the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Act or thing previously done by Chief Executive in Council or Authority

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: is in force immediately before the commencement date,

section.continued: continues to be in force on or after the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Ongoing inquiry, investigation, etc.

subsection.leadIn: An inquiry or investigation that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been started before the commencement date by the Authority under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been determined, concluded or otherwise disposed of immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: may continue on or after the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: A right of appeal under section 34 of this Ordinance that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsists immediately before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: concerns a decision, direction, order or determination in relation to an act or omission that occurred before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: continues to subsist on or after the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.content: An appeal under section 34 of this Ordinance that is pending immediately before the commencement date may be continued and disposed of on or after the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

This Ordinance applies to a non-compliance or suspected non-compliance with a provision of this Ordinance, a direction, order or determination under this Ordinance or a licence condition, that occurred before the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted, even if the act or omission constituting the non-compliance or suspected non-compliance is only discovered on or after the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: However, if the act or omission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues on or after the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no longer constitutes such a non-compliance or suspected non-compliance under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance,

subsection.continued: this Ordinance applies only to the non-compliance or suspected non-compliance that occurred before the commencement date and as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Pending application for approval

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been made before the commencement date to seek approval of the Chief Executive in Council or the Authority under section 3(2), 20 or 33(1) of Schedule 1 or section 6 of Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is pending immediately before the commencement date.

subsection.content: The application is to be dealt with under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance.

However, if the application or part of the application would not be necessary under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance, the application or the part is taken to have been withdrawn on the commencement date.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Pending application for licence

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been submitted before the commencement date to the Authority under section 9(1) of this Ordinance for a domestic free television programme service licence or domestic pay television programme service licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application has not been determined immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: the application is to be dealt with under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the commencement date, the Authority has made recommendations on the application under section 9(2) of this Ordinance, the Chief Executive in Council may on or after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rely on the recommendations for the purposes of sections 9(2) and 10(1) of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: request the Authority to—

subparagraph.content: reconsider the application; and
make fresh recommendations.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Pending application for extension or renewal of licence

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been submitted before the commencement date to the Authority under section 11(2) of this Ordinance for the extension or renewal of a domestic free television programme service licence or domestic pay television programme service licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application has not been determined immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: the application is to be dealt with under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the commencement date, the Authority has submitted recommendations on the application under section 11(3) of this Ordinance, the Chief Executive in Council may on or after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rely on the recommendations for the purposes of section 11(3) and (5) of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request the Authority to submit fresh recommendations.
